citation.article-title: Pseudomonas pohangensis sp. nov., isolated from seashore sand in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas pohangensis sp. nov.
Pseudomonas pohangensis (po.hang.en′sis. N.L. adj. pohangensis referring to Pohang city in Korea, where the type strain was found).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods approximately 0.6–0.8×1.5–3.0 μm in size.
Colonies are irregular and cream-coloured after 48 h on MA.
Cells are non-fluorescent on King A and B media.
Growth occurs at temperatures of 4–35 °C (optimum 25–30 °C), pH 5–9 (optimum pH 7–8) and at NaCl concentrations of up to 3.0 % (optimum 1.0 %).
Does not hydrolyse alginic acid, casein, chitin, carboxymethylcellulose, DNA, gelatin, starch, tyrosine or urea.
Major fatty acids are summed feature 3 and C16 : 0, with lesser amounts of C12 : 0, C12 : 0 3-OH, C 18 : 1ω7c and C14 : 0.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-9.
The DNA G+C content is 64.0 mol%.
The type strain, H3-R18T (=KACC 11517T=DSM 17875T), was isolated from seashore sand collected from Homi cape, Pohang city, Korea.
